data.title: Traffic Advisories
data.meta_description: Last updated: Aug. 8The following traffic advisories reflect current conditions as they are known. The listings below reflect construction work that can affect travel on city streets, sidewalks and trails (note: excludes individual lane closures or lane and sidewalk closures associated with development projects). Expect traffic delays or use an alternate route, if possible. Please obey construction signs and flaggers. Construction schedules are subject to change and often do.
data.text:
Special Event Advisories

2024 Fred Hutch Obliteride Bike Ride | Saturday, August 10th, 7:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

Obliteride bike riders will be traveling through Bellevue on Saturday, August 10th. Bikers will follow the rules of the road using bike lanes, shoulders, multi-use paths and vehicular traveled lanes (where bike lanes do not exist). Uniformed police officers will be stationed at signalized major intersections. Bikers will be using the following routes for the event:

Northern route (7:00 – 10:00 a.m.)

520 Trail – Bikers enter City of Bellevue at Lake Washington Blvd. NE. off of the 520 trail and head east on Northup Way

Northup Way – Bikers travel southeast to NE 24th St.

NE 24th St. – Bikers travel east toward the 520 trail

520 Trail – Bikers travel east on the 520 trail, cross 148th Ave NE and continue on 520 trail into City of Redmond.

Southern Route (8:45 a.m. – 3:30 p.m.)

SE Newport Way – Bikers enter City of Bellevue at SE Newport Way and Lakemont Blvd. SE. traveling westbound on SE Newport Way to Factoria Blvd.

Factoria Blvd. – Bikers will travel southbound to Coal Creek Parkway

Coal Creek Pkwy. – Bikers travel north bound under 405 and transition into Lake Washington Blvd. SE.

Lake Washington Blvd. SE. - Bikers travel north bound up to I-90 Trail.

I-90 Trail – Bikers will travel west bound on the trail toward Mercer Island.

Indian Independence Day Celebration and Parade | Thursday, August 15th, 5:00 - 9 p.m.

The Indian Independence Day Celebration and Parade will take place in downtown Bellevue on Thursday, August 15th between 5:00 -9:00 p.m. Please see below for the start times for planned road closures on 110th Avenue Northeast and NE 2nd Place:

Starting at 11:00 am:

Full closure of 110th Ave NE between City Hall Visitor Parking and NE 6th Street

Full closure of NE 2nd Place between 110th Ave NE and 111th Ave NE for float staging.

Starting at 4:00 pm

Additional closure on 110th Ave NE between NE 4th Street and just north of City Hall Visitor parking closing northbound travel on 110th Ave NE.

City Hall Visitor parking will not be accessible after 4pm to the general public.

Traffic control officers will coordinate vehicles exiting the garage between 4 – 6 p.m.

Starting at 5:45 pm

Floats will leave the staging area NE 2nd Place and travel up 110th Avenue NE. Floats will cross intersection of 110th Ave NE and NE 4th St. on the green light..

Starting at 6:30 pm

Parade begins. Floats will travel northbound on 110th Avenue NE between NE 4th St and NE 6th St. Once the performance is complete, floats will cross the intersection of 110th Ave NE and NE 6th St. on the green light. Floats will pull into the parking lot on the east side of 110th Ave NE (755 110th Ave NE).

Additional notes:

All roads are expected to be open by midnight (12 a.m.) that evening (8/15)

Metro access to the Bellevue Transit Center will remain open during the event.

Ongoing construction impacts

Factoria Boulevard SE from SE 38th Street to SE 36th Street: Alternating lane closures starting Jan. 9 for initial construction activities for the Factoria Boulevard Stormwater Conveyance Improvements project. Visit BellevueWA.gov/factoria-stormwater-project for more information

Lakemont Boulevard SE from Forest Drive SE to 155th Avenue SE: Lakemont Boulevard reopened for travel on Tuesday, June 11. Potential for intermittent one lane closures (day and night) through Jun. 27 for final construction wrap-up. Visit BellevueWA.gov/lakemont-culvert for more information.

UPDATED — 124th Avenue NE from Ichigo Way to Northup Way: Crews have begun final construction activities which will take place through the summer including removing construction vehicles and equipment and restoring private properties impacted by the project. Intermittent single-lane closures may be required to complete this work. As you approach the work area, please lower your speeds and follow all flagger instructions, including electronic and detour message signs. The project is anticipated to be substantially complete in early fall 2024. More information is available on the project webpage.

130th Avenue NE - BelRed Road to NE 20th Street: Starting May 31, 130th Avenue NE will turn into a single, northbound-onlyto install new utilities and begin the first stage of a new roadway on 130th Avenue NE. Signed detour via 132nd between NE 20th and Bel-Red Road. Local access to businesses will be maintained. Construction anticipated through July 2025. More information is available on the project webpage.
